intro: Lepidium leventii, commonly known as the desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert environments. Lepidium leventii is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with minimal water availability.
